definition: to go smoothly/prosperous/going well
prosperous/henry (unit of inductance)
classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)
to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc
(of a political career) everything is going smoothly (idiom)
everything is going smoothly (idiom)
our luck is in, everything is going smoothly (idiom)

sentences.english: It wouldn't be the first time a fool got over-promoted.
sentences.chinese: 蠢才官運亨通並非沒有先例。

sentences.english: If you commit your finances to God it will probably mean cutting back on your spending.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想讓上帝保佑你財運亨通，那你就得節省開支。

sentences.english: May good fortune find you this year.
sentences.chinese: 祝你今年財運亨通，財源不斷。

sentences.english: As long as he sought the Lord , God gave him success.
sentences.chinese: 他尋求耶和華，神就使他亨通。

sentences.english: Senator in a scandal he’ll loose his beltway to the fast track.
sentences.chinese: 要是議員涉足醜聞，他的亨通仕途就此終結了。

sentences.english: If they obey and serve him, they shall spend their days in prosperity, and their years in pleasures.
sentences.chinese: 他們若聽從事奉他，就必度日亨通，歷年福樂。

sentences.english: May you have standing in Ephrathah and be famous in Bethlehem.
sentences.chinese: 又願你在以法他得亨通，在伯利恆得名聲。
於是建造城邑，諸事亨通。

sentences.english: Facing south on behalf of the sky, many fortunes, good Feng Shui.
sentences.chinese: 坐北朝南代表頂天立地，財運亨通，風水好。

definition: profits pouring in from all sides (idiom)/raking in money/bonanza
wealth and profit/riches
our luck is in, everything is going smoothly (idiom)
everything is going smoothly (idiom)
everything is going smoothly/just as one wishes
riches and honor
very rich/millionaire
easy money/windfall/ill-gotten gains/undeserved fortune/illegal profit
to make easy money/to make a fortune/to line one's pockets
the time comes, fortune turns (idiom); to have a lucky break/things change for the better
variant of 紅運|红运[hong2 yun4]
horoscope/one's fortune
to make money
lit. there are principles behind making money (idiom); fig. to have a knack for good business/knowing how to accumulate wealth/good at feathering one's own nest
god of wealth
(of a political career) everything is going smoothly (idiom)
